condition.description:
Sinusitis means your sinuses are inflamed. The cause can be an infection or another problem. Your sinuses are hollow air spaces within the bones surrounding the nose. They produce mucus, which drains into the nose. If your nose is swollen, this can block the sinuses and cause pain.

There are several types of sinusitis, including

  • Acute, which lasts up to 4 weeks
  • Subacute, which lasts 4 to 12 weeks
  • Chronic, which lasts more than 12 weeks and can continue for months or even years
  • Recurrent, with several attacks within a year

Acute sinusitis often starts as a cold, which then turns into a bacterial infection. Allergies, nasal problems, and certain diseases can also cause acute and chronic sinusitis.

Symptoms of sinusitis can include fever, weakness, fatigue, cough, and congestion. There may also be mucus drainage in the back of the throat, called postnasal drip. Your health care professional diagnoses sinusitis based on your symptoms and an examination of your nose and face. You may also need imaging tests. Treatments include antibiotics, decongestants, and pain relievers. Using heat pads on the inflamed area, saline nasal sprays, and vaporizers can also help.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
condition.name: Sinusitis

carousel_items: Take this medication exactly as your doctor tells you to.
Take each dose with a meal since it may cause an upset stomach.
If you are taking birth control pills, this can make it less effective.
Store the suspension in the refrigerator. All other forms can be kept at room temperature.

basics.benefits_moa: Augmentin is a combination antibiotic. Amoxicillin kills bacteria and prevents them from reproducing and making their own protective covering. Clavulanate stops chemicals the bacteria make to resist antibiotics.
basics.bottom_line: Augmentin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as generic. However, it will make birth control pills less effective. It also has to be taken with food since it can cause an upset stomach.
downsides: If you're on birth control pills, you should use a barrier method (condoms, diaphragms) since Augmentin can make them less effective.
Should be taken with food since it can cause stomach upset.
If you have phenylketonuria (PKU), talk to your doctor to prescribe an alternative.

downsides_processed.orig: If you're on birth control pills, you should use a barrier method (condoms, diaphragms) since Augmentin can make them less effective.
Should be taken with food since it can cause stomach upset.
If you have phenylketonuria (PKU), talk to your doctor to prescribe an alternative.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take this medication exactly as your doctor tells you to.
Take each dose with a meal since it may cause an upset stomach.
If you are taking birth control pills, this can make it less effective.
Store the suspension in the refrigerator. All other forms can be kept at room temperature.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: If you have mononucleosis (mono), contact your doctor for alternatives. Taking Augmentin when you have mononucleosis can cause a rash.

description_processed.orig: If you have mononucleosis (mono), contact your doctor for alternatives. Taking Augmentin when you have mononucleosis can cause a rash.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Augmentin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Augmentin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you are taking Augmentin and you are also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Augmentin.

description_processed.orig: If you are taking Augmentin and you are also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Augmentin.

Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.

basics.benefits_moa: Bactrim is a combination antibiotic that contains sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim. It kills bacteria by preventing them from making proteins and other chemicals that keep them alive.
basics.bottom_line: Bactrim is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as a generic. However, you can be more likely to sunburn. Also, it can cause birth defects, so talk to your doctor if you're pregnant.
downsides: Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of liquids.
May cause birth defects.

downsides_processed.orig: Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of liquids.
May cause birth defects.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see if Bactrim responds to your infection.

basics.benefits_moa: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Azithromycin is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease, myasthenia gravis, or on medications to thin the blood, as the doctor may write an alternative.
downsides: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

basics.benefits_moa: Levofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Levofloxacin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as generic. However, it can cause damage to your tendons, and make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

risks_warnings.description: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

description_processed.orig: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

carousel_items: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

basics.benefits_moa: Nasonex is a topical steroid. It works directly where it's applied to help reduce swelling and inflammation in your nose.
basics.bottom_line: Nasonex is a good first-choice treatment for stuffy and runny noses caused by allergies, but it's not available as a generic so it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

userStories.tip: After three months of use, caused dry mouth.  I have used Flonase without this problem.
I changed insurance and the price went thru the roof. A pharmacist told me Nasocort is in the same family  (glucosteroid I think) and is non Rx. Working great so far!
switched to non Rx Nasocort and it works just as well.
Takes a while before it starts to work.  Don't wait until symptoms are bad to start taking it.

drugs.name: Nasonex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

risks_warnings.title: Thrush in the nose and throat
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in the nasal septum
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.

risks_warnings.title: Glaucoma and cataracts
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced immune system
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.
risk_factors: Exposure to immunizable diseases (chickenpox and measles)

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.

risks_warnings.title: Decrease in growth in children and teenagers
risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.
